name: If You Could Meet Anyone In History ... Multiple Choice Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which work is by Edgar Allan Poe?
questions.correct: The Narrative of A. Gordon Pym
questions.explanation:
The Narrative of A. Gordon Pym

	Poe: A rare combination of creativity, imagination, genius - and deep torment.

questions.text: Which character is NOT found in Shakespeare's plays?
questions.explanation:
Algernon.

	Shakespeare: Considered the greatest writer of the English language. Plays and poems.

questions.text: Which is NOT a work by Leonardo Da Vinci?
questions.explanation:
The Garden of Earthly Delights.

	Da Vinci: The ultimate Renaissance man. Art and Science.

questions.text: Abraham Lincoln is associated with Illinois. Where was he born?
questions.explanation:
Kentucky.

	Lincoln: An amazing man. What a life: greatness, inner complexity, melancholy, war, deaths, etc.

questions.text: Which is NOT a work by Freud?
options: Wit and Its Relation to the Unconscious
questions.explanation:
Beyond Freedom and Dignity.

	Freud: No one has had a more profound impact on modern man and the way that he thinks about himself.

questions.text: Who was Thomas Jefferson's principal opponent that he defeated in  the 1800 election for the U.S. Presidency?
questions.explanation:
John Adams.

	Jefferson: The American version of the renaissance man. Perhaps our brightest and most scholarly president.

questions.text: Joan of Arc endeavored to have what individual crowned as King?
questions.explanation:
Dauphin.

	Joan: Divinely inspired, mad or both?

Wellington.

	Napoleon was huge figure in European History, but it's hard to get a feel for what he was really like.

questions.text: Which is true of Beethoven, but not of Mozart?
questions.correct: Scholars have attempted to discern the identity of his 'Immortal Beloved'
options: His relationship with his father, Leopold, was difficult
questions.explanation:
Scholars have attempted to discern the identity of his 'Immortal Beloved'.

	Mozart and Beethoven: One went from early brilliance to early death;  the other suffered through deafness. Geniuses - but hard lives.

questions.text: Which work was NOT done by either Van Gogh or Michelangelo?
questions.explanation:
The Thinker.

	Van Gogh and Michelangelo: One hears so much about the troubled, turbulent life of Van Gogh. At the same time, David and the Sistine Chapel are widely regarded as two of the greatest accomplishments in the world of art.
